comments:
On a pretty young running instance of Eclipse, when trying to do a copy/paste of a Java file (which I do regularly without issue), I just got the following error reported:

Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Requested array size exceeds VM limit
Root exception:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Requested array size exceeds VM limit

Here is my VM config:
-vmargs
-XX:MaxPermSize=128m
-Xms256m
-Xmx512m

I didn't see any other similar bug reports and this is the first time ever that i see this.

The most interesting part of the stack trace is missing: What code tried to create the huge array...!
To do something here, we need that trace or a reproducable example. Setting the bug to REMIND. Please ropen if you have more information.

This is the only part of the stack trace that was available. Believe me I didn't truncate it on purpose.

BTW, I got the same issue today again doing other things and the only log that I have is:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-09-05 12:05:26.732
